title: How to Face Paint a Skull

steps.title: Collect your materials.
steps.content: Collect your materials. Painting your face to look like a skull is quite easy, but you will need a few special paint brushes and face paints to accomplish this look. Before you get started, you will need: [1] X Research source face paints in white, grey, and black a small paintbrush for outlining and detailing a thick paintbrush for filling in large areas a fine paintbrush for precise details a cup of water for thinning out face paint

steps.title: Outline your eyes.
steps.content: Outline your eyes. Use your small paintbrush and white paint to paint white lines all around your eye sockets. This is the area just below your eyebrows and about an inch or two below your lower eyelid. Try to trace along the bones around your eyes to create this outline. [2] X Research source If the face paint seems too thick, then you can just dip your brush into the water before dipping it into the paint. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Create the mask outline around your forehead and cheeks.
steps.content: Create the mask outline around your forehead and cheeks. Next, use the small paintbrush and white face paint to create an outline that extends over your forehead and around your cheekbones as well. The outline should then curve down towards your lips and end at the corner of your lips. [4] X Research source Your outline should resemble the shape of a skull when you are done.

steps.title: Draw a triangle above each nostril.
steps.content: Draw a triangle above each nostril. Use the white face paint and your thin paintbrush to create two triangles right above each of your nostrils. There should be one triangle above each nostril when you are done. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Fill in the outline.
steps.content: Fill in the outline. Next, switch to a larger brush to fill in the large area that you just outlined with white face paint. Do not fill in the triangles above your nostrils or the areas around your eyes. Leave these areas unpainted for now. [6] X Research source Allow this first coat of face paint to dry completely before you start shading or adding details. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Cover your eyebrows with grey face paint.
steps.content: Cover your eyebrows with grey face paint. Use your small paintbrush to paint over your eyebrows with grey face paint. You can even extend the paint past your eyebrows a bit so that it looks like you have extra bushy grey eyebrows. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Draw grey half circles.
steps.content: Draw grey half circles. Use the grey face paint to draw a half circle in the middle of the white painted area below your eye. The ends of the half circle should be facing up towards your eye. Blend the half circle into the white paint so that it is somewhat blurry. [9] X Research source Repeat this process under your other eye.

steps.title: Shade the lower edges of the mask.
steps.content: Shade the lower edges of the mask. Use grey face paint on your small brush to shade in the lower edges of the skull shape. This is the area just below your cheekbones. Make sure that you shade in both sides. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Create lines above your upper lip.
steps.content: Create lines above your upper lip. Next, use the grey face paint and your thin brush to create vertical lines along the area above your upper lip. Do not draw these lines on your actual lip, just on the area above your lip. [11] X Research source Start by making one line in the center of the area above your upper lip and then move out from there.

steps.title: Go over the grey areas with black.
steps.content: Go over the grey areas with black. Switch to a thin brush and dip it into black face paint. Use the face paint to darken the grey areas that you just created. Go over each of the lines that you made with the grey paint to help define them a little more. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Paint your eye sockets black.
steps.content: Paint your eye sockets black. Take your large brush and use it to paint the areas around your eyes with black face paint. Cover the eyelids and the areas under and beside your eyes with black face paint. [13] X Research source To make these areas extra dark, you can also add a bit of black eyeliner to your waterline on your lower eyelid. Since this design requires you to paint the areas around the eyes, it may not be the best design for young kids. Kids tend to rub their eyes and may get face paint into their eyes. [14] X Research source If you want to use this design for a young child, then consider leaving the areas around the eyes unpainted.

steps.title: Fill in the triangles above your nostrils.
steps.content: Fill in the triangles above your nostrils. Use your small paintbrush to fill in the triangles above your nostrils. Be careful to keep the black paint inside of the white lines. [15] X Research source If the small brush seems too big to fill in the triangles, then you can also use the thin brush to fill them in.

steps.title: Outline the entire mask with black.
steps.content: Outline the entire mask with black. Next, take your small paintbrush and use it to outline your entire mask with black face paint. Try to draw long continuous lines rather than short lines. [16] X Research source If necessary, go over the lines again to make them thicker.

steps.title: Create the teeth.
steps.content: Create the teeth. Start in the center of your upper lip and draw a vertical black line. Then, continue making vertical black lines along the length of your upper lip and just above your upper lip as well. Close off the teeth with pointed tops. [17] X Research source After you have outlined all of your teeth, you can go over your teeth again with the black face paint to make them darker. Draw thin black lines extending from the top of the teeth as well to make them look more realistic. Add a dot of white face paint to the center of each tooth to highlight it.
